entry.name: greenhouse gases
entry.desc: gas in an atmosphere of a planet (usually Earth) that absorbs and emits radiation within the thermal infrared range and causes the greenhouse effect

entry.name: Agriculture, Forestry and Other Land Use
Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change
entry.desc: (IPCC) is an intergovernmental body of the United Nations responsible for advancing knowledge on human-induced climate change

entry.name: United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs
entry.desc: government organization in New York, United States

entry.name: Special Report on Climate Change and Land
entry.desc: SRCCL, desertification, land degradation, sustainable land management, food security, and greenhouse gas fluxes in terrestrial ecosystems

entry.name: Intergovernmental Platform on Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services
entry.desc: scientific intergovernmental body which assesses the state of biodiversity

entry.name: Sustainable Development Goals
entry.desc: set of United Nations-defined global development goals and climate change

entry.name: Shared Socioeconomic Pathways
entry.desc: scenarios of projected socioeconomic global changes up to 2100

entry.name: Least Developed Countries
entry.desc: list of countries that exhibits the lowest indicators of socioeconomic development

entry.name: particulate matter
entry.desc: microscopic solid or liquid matter suspended in the Earth's atmosphere

entry.name: nature-based solutions
entry.desc: sustainable management and use of nature for tackling socio-environmental challenges

entry.name: transit-oriented development
entry.desc: urban development that maximizes the amount of residential, business, and leisure space within walking distance of public transport

entry.name: gross domestic product
entry.desc: market value of goods and services produced within a country

entry.name: Willingness to pay
entry.desc: Economic concept of the maximum price a buyer is willing and able to give in a transaction

entry.name: urban heat island
entry.desc: urban area that is significantly warmer than its surrounding rural areas due to human activities

entry.name: non-governmental organization
entry.desc: organization independent of any government, usually created to aid those in need

entry.name: World Health Organization
entry.desc: specialized agency of the United Nations that is concerned with international public health

entry.name: International Resource Panel
entry.desc: The International Resource Panel is a scientific panel of experts that aims to help nations use natural resources sustainably without compromising economic growth and human needs

entry.name: strategic environmental assessments
entry.desc: (SEA) is a systematic decision support process, aiming to ensure that environmental and possibly other sustainability aspects are considered effectively in policy, plan and program making.

entry.name: Internet of Things
entry.desc: proposed Internet-like structure connecting everyday physical objects

entry.name: electric vehicle
entry.desc: vehicle propelled by one or more electric motors
official currency of the People's Republic of China

entry.name: Global Change Observation Mission
entry.desc: project of long-term observation of Earth environmental changes

entry.name: International Council for Local Environmental Initiatives
entry.desc: international organization

entry.name: photovoltaics
entry.desc: method of converting solar radiation into direct current electricity

entry.name: electric vehicle
entry.desc: vehicle propelled by one or more electric motors

entry.name: Avoid-Shift-Improve
entry.desc: approach to environmental sustainability by changing consumer behavior
